intro: Ficus lichtensteinii, commonly known as the Lichtenstein's fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into edible figs. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its ability to tolerate drought and its attractive foliage. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
